intro: Senecio angosturae, commonly known as the Angostura groundsel, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly found in regions of Ecuador and Peru. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in high-altitude grasslands and shrublands, thriving in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are usually narrow and linear, while its flowers consist of both ray and disk florets. Senecio angosturae is often used in local horticulture and has some traditional medicinal applications.
